message: It has now reached the point where mnesia has wasted most of my time in the last 3 weeks.  First a network partition, now trying to upgrade an application that has indexes to R14B01.  It'll still probably take another half hour for this node to come up…
someone should build a mnesia query engine like for couchdb
how wide is your cluster? what advice can you offer to anyone else about to embark on an mnesia deployment after these experiences? is it just "don't"?
rabbitmq seems to be fairly set-and-forget even though it uses mnesia behind the scenes, though I haven't run it in clustered mode yet
@wil We don't run a RabbitMQ in a cluster either partly because we'd rather just give it a really beefy machine than learn what happens when you get a network partition with it.
@rboyd I am about to start a project with mnesia.  Why should I not use it?
@dreid btw how big is your mnesia database?
@wil not terribly big 56.92MB.  It's the indexes that'll get ya.  They have to be rebuilt from scratch when you restart the node.
We also have much bigger mnesia databases than that.
